questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    how many child education centres there are country-wide;
(b)    what measures have been taken to sustain the centres; and
(c)    when the centres will be provided with trained teachers and teaching materials.

questions.minister: Minister of Community Development, Mother and Child Health
parts: (a)    how many qualified personnel were stationed at Nsudzu Mental Health Centre in Chadiza Parliamentary Constituency as of March, 2015;
(b)    when the rehabilitation of the Centre will commence; and
(c)    what the cost of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Lands, Natural Resources and Environmental Protection
parts: (a)    when funds for aforestation of the Nakonde Forest in Nakonde Parliamentary Constituency will be released;
(b)    what the cost of the exercise is; and
(c)    what the time-frame for the exercise is.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    whether any mineral exploration has been carried out in Mitete District;
(b)    if so, what minerals were found; and
(c)    when mining activities will commence.

questions.minister: Minister of Mines, Energy and Water Development
parts: (a)    whether there is potential for development of a cement plant in Mpongwe District; and
(b)    if so, whether the Government has any plans to find an investor to set up a cement plant in the District.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when Laurent Chita and Ipusukilo Primary Schools in Luwingu District will be upgraded to Secondary Schools; and
(b)    what has caused the delay in upgrading the Schools.

parts: (a)    how many students applied for government bursaries at the following institutions of learning for the 2013/2014 academic year:
(i)    University of Zambia; (ii)    Copperbelt University; and (iii)    Mulungushi University; and
(b)    how many students had their applications approved, institution by institution.
(a)    when the dilapidated houses at Kalabo District Hospital Compound will be rehabilitated; and
(b)    what the long term plans for rehabilitation of hospital houses are. QUESTIONS FOR WRITTEN ANSWER W65    Mr Mutelo (Lukulu West) - to ask the Minister of Finance:
(a)    what the impact of the proposed revision of mineral taxes on the 2015 budget is;
(b)    what measures have been taken to bridge the gap in the revenue loss arising from the revision of the taxes at (a);
(c)    what the impact of the revision on the external and domestic debt is; and
(d)    what the revised economic growth rate for 2015, in view of the developments at (a) and (c) above, is. W66    Mr Lufuma (Kabompo West) - to ask the Vice President:
(a)    whether the Government has any plans to undertake a delimitation exercise to increase the number of parliamentary constituencies;
(b)    if so, when the exercise will commence;
(c)    how many additional constituencies are expected to be created countrywide; and
(d)    whether any new constituencies will be created in Kabompo District. W67    Mr Namulambe (Mpongwe) - to ask the Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education:
(a)    what the rates of boarding fees payable at the following Secondary Schools are:
(i)    Ibenga Girls; (ii)    Fatima Girls; (iii)    Chiwala Boys; (iv)    Ndola Technical;
(v)    Mpongwe; and (vi)    Mpongwe South; and

(b)    why there are disparities in the amounts. W68    Mr I Banda (Lumezi) - to ask the Minister of Transport, Works, Supply and Communication how much money is spent on the following by the Road Transport and Safety Agency, per annum:
(a)    personal emoluments;
(b)    servicing of motor vehicles; and
(c)    servicing the Board of Directors. W69    Mr Mucheleka (Lubansenshi) - to ask the Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education:
(a)    how many teachers were posted to Lubansenshi Parliamentary Constituency from January, 2013 to April, 2015, by year and by gender;
(b)    to which schools the teachers were posted; and

(c)    what the total shortfall of teachers in the Constituency is.
